Toggle doesn´t work.</p>\n<p>Can I add an id to the last Javascript so that if I click on the menu AND on the button that nothing is triggered? Because I think the two scripts &quot;block&quot; each other what makes sense to me as the button tries to show the menu and the other script tries to hide it when I click out.</p>\n<p>Hope u can understand and thanks for your help!</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>//Toggle nav menu to show and hide\n\ndocument.getElementById(\"hamburger-menu-div\").addEventListener(\"click\", function() {\n    var x = document.getElementById(\"mobile-navigation\");\n    if (x.style.display === \"block\") {\n        x.style.display = \"none\";\n    }\n    else\n    {\n        x.style.display = \"block\";\n    }\n});\n\n\n\n//Hide it when clicked outside\n\ndocument.addEventListener('mouseup', function(e) {\n  var container = document.getElementById('mobile-navigation');\n  if (!container.contains(e.target)) {\n    container.style.display = 'none';\n  }\n});</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.hamburger-menu-div {\n  background-color: lightblue;\n  width: 250px;\n  height: 50px;\n}\n\n.mobile-navigation {\n  background-color: lightgreen;\n  width: 250px;\n  display: none;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div id=\"hamburger-menu-div\" class=\"hamburger-menu-div\"&gt;\nBUTTON\n&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;div id=\"mobile-navigation\" class=\"mobile-navigation\"&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;- Navigationpoint 1&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;- Navigationpoint 2&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;- Navigationpoint 3&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;- Navigationpoint 4&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;p&gt;- Navigationpoint 5&lt;/p&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":159,"question_id":65030265,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>So, I should create some functions with chains for validating, example:</p>\n<pre><code>isValid('Test string').required().isString().min(5);\n</code></pre>\n<p>and function should throw an error if something isn't comparing.</p>\n<p>I have a problem, if something throw an error, than it doesn't continue work, I tried to add try catch, but then tests shows me that it don't throw an error. I want to pass test with .toThrowError() and continue chaining</p>\n<pre><code>function isValid(str) {\n\n  return {\n    required: function() {\n        if (str === '') {\n          console.log(&quot;dasdsada2&quot;,str, this)\n          throw new Error('Required!');\n        }\n        return this;\n    },\n    isString: () =&gt; {\n        if (typeof str !== 'string') {\n          throw new Error('Should be a string!');\n        }\n        return this;\n    },\n    min: (minNum) =&gt; {\n        if (str.length &lt; minNum) {\n          throw new Error('Should be more than min'); \n        }\n        return this;\n    }\n  };  \n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":161,"question_id":65030246,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I work on a web application and need to incorporate editable tables in an HTML page. Found awesome JS tool &quot;Tabulator&quot;, however, faced with lack of my basic fundamental knowledge in data transferring from server to client and back. Well, get to the point. <br/>\nOn server-side:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Node.js file, let say <code>app.js</code></li>\n<li>required data is stored in Mongo DB in two collections, User and Resource</li>\n</ul>\n<p>On client-side:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>HTML file <code>stat.html</code> to embedded two Tabulator's table</li>\n<li>JS file <code>table.js</code></li>\n</ul>\n<p>=== Stage 1. Send data from server to client ===<br/></p>\n<p>Step 1. <code>app.js</code> pulls data from Mongo DB and sends it to <code>table.js</code></p>\n<pre><code>//=== render stat.html page ===//\nrouter.get('/stat', (req,res)=&gt;{\n    res.render('stat');\n});\n\n//=== pull user data from mongo and send it to table.js ===//\nrouter.get('/stat', (req,res) =&gt; {\n    User.find({}, (err, users) =&gt; {\n        if (err) throw err;\n        res.send(users);\n    });\n});\n\n//=== pull resource data from mongoand send it to table.js ===//\nrouter.get('/stat', (req,res) =&gt; {\n    Resource.find({}, (err, resources) =&gt; {\n        if (err) throw err;\n        res.send(resources);\n    });\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>Here I've got several questions:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Question #1. Do I do it right?</li>\n<li>Question #2. Is it possible to render the page and send data to client JS in one route? I tried but got an error.</li>\n<li>Question #3. The output from mongoose <code>Collection.find</code> is in JSON format and it's what Tabulator needs. Do I need to manipulate it anyhow before sending it to the client-side? For instance use <code>JSON.stringify</code></li>\n<li>Question #4. Is there any way to check if data is actually sending?</li>\n<li>Question #5. I need to send two different JSONs for different tables. If they are sent in one route how to separate one from the other on the client-side? I was thinking to use different paths, like <code>/stat/user</code> and <code>/stat/resource</code> but then how to trigger them?</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Step 2. On the client-side <code>table.js</code> file receives data and feeds it to Tabulator tables. Tabulator has its own option to request remote data <code>ajaxURL</code></p>\n<pre><code>//setup user table\nvar table = new Tabulator('#user-table',{\n    ajaxURL:&quot;stat/user&quot;,\n});\n\n//setup resource table\nvar table = new Tabulator('#resource-table',{\n    ajaxURL:&quot;stat/resource&quot;,\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>Questions:</p>\n<ol start=\"6\">\n<li>Question #6. Since there're two tables on the page I need to use two different URLs. And this brings back to Question #5. How to trigger these paths when rendering the page</li>\n<li>Question #7. Assuming that there's no <code>ajaxURL</code> how data can be read in <code>table.js</code>? {"body":"<p>First time trying node and express. },\n    { &quot;author&quot;: &quot;you&quot;, &quot;title&quot;: &quot;BookB&quot;, &quot;pages&quot;: 400, &quot;quality&quot;: &quot;used&quot; },\n    { &quot;author&quot;: &quot;us&quot;, &quot;title&quot;: &quot;BookC&quot;, &quot;pages&quot;: 500, &quot;quality&quot;: &quot;old&quot; },\n];\n\n// request handler to search based on two fields: author and title\napp.get('/book', function (req, res) {\n    // get the query params\n    var title = req.query.title;\n\n    // initialize the return data\n    var data;\n\n    // search for the book\n    for (var i = 0; i &lt; books.length; i++) {\n        if (books[i].title == title) {\n            data = books[i];\n            break;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // pass JSON back to client\n    res.set('Content-type', 'application/json');\n    res.status(200);\n    res.send({&quot;book&quot;: data});\n});\n\n// post handler to add a book to the hardcoded list\n// this is definitely not the correct model for storing data\n// this is simply an example\napp.post('/book', function (req, res) {\n    // access the request POST body from the request object\n    var data = req.body.data;\n\n    // add the new book to the data store and return it\n    var book = {\n        &quot;author&quot;: req.body.author,\n        &quot;title&quot;: req.body.title,\n        &quot;pages&quot;: req.body.pages,\n        &quot;quality&quot;: req.body.quality,\n    }\n\n    // add the book to the hardcoded list of books\n    books.push(book);\n\n    // return JSON list of books\n    res.set('Content-type', 'application/json');\n    res.status(201);\n    res.send({&quot;books&quot;: books});\n});\n\n// listen for HTTP requests on port 3000\napp.listen(3000, function() {\n    console.log(&quot;listening on port 3000&quot;);\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>I have this for DELETE just not sure if it'll work. {"body":"<p>My application places bets on certain sporting events. Almost like an automatic betting bot. A part of this is to track the current status of the event so it can make an informed calculation whether to place a bet or not. To do this, I poll the status of an event every minute using <code>setInterval</code>. A single sporting event is &quot;watched&quot; by <strong>1</strong> child process. There could be up 100+ sporting events at any one time meaning there could be 100+ child process' spawned &amp; actively polling.</p>\n<p><strong><code>worker/index.js</code></strong></p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const logger = require('../lib/logger/winston')\nconst utils = {\n    updateEventState: require('../utils/update-event-state')\n}\nconst db = require('../db')\n\nlet eventStatesInterval\n\nmodule.exports = async function() {\n    try {\n        logger.info(`[STARTED FOR EVENT ${process.EVENT_ID} (Process: ${process.pid})]`)\n\n        const event = await db.getEvent(process.EVENT_ID)\n\n        logger.info(`[STARTING STATE POLLING FOR EVENT (${process.EVENT_ID} - Process: ${process.pid})]`)\n\n        eventStatesInterval = setInterval(utils.updateEventState, 60000, event) // 1 min\n\n        process.on('exit', code =&gt; {\n            clearInterval(eventStatesInterval)\n        })\n    } catch(err) {\n        throw err\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong><code>utils/update-event-state.js</code></strong></p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const logger = require('../lib/logger/winston')\nconst db = require('../db')\n\nmodule.exports = async function(event) {\n    try {\n        const update = {}\n\n        if (!process.CHECKING_EVENT) {\n            process.CHECKING_EVENT = true\n\n            logger.info(`[POLLING STATE (${process.EVENT_ID} - Process: ${process.pid})]`)\n\n            // Some async operations polling APIs to get the full status of an event\n            const hasEnded = await api.getHasEventEnded(process.EVENT_ID)\n\n            await db.updateEvent(process.EVENT_ID, update)\n\n            if (hasEnded) {\n                process.exit(0)\n            }\n            process.CHECKING_EVENT = false\n        }\n    } catch(err) {\n        throw err\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>It's also worth noting that a single child process <em>could</em> have more <code>setInterval</code> process' further down the line. For example, if I place a bet that is not fully matched. I poll to check when/if it gets matched. This is also run on a <code>setInterval</code> basis <em>(about every 5 secs)</em>. Check ing the logs, some process' are polled correctly every minute but a couple <em>(inconsistent number each time)</em> are not being polled at all. Looking at the logs for a specific process, I get:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/0aSQB.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/0aSQB.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p><em>For reference, the current time was 22:33 when that screenshot was taken so the interval had not happened in over an hour</em></p>\n<p>There was only 4 events <em>(child process')</em> running at the time.</p>\n<p>That is an <strong>example</strong> screenshot. A process can log several interval callbacks &amp; then just...stop. No more logs at all. No errors or anything. Just stops.</p>\n<p>This application runs on a Digital Ocean box with 4GB memory &amp; 2 vCPUs. The app is dockerised. When running <code>docker stats</code>, 100% CPU is being used constantly. When starting with <code>docker run</code>, I limit the memory usage but not the CPU. Could this be the issue? Would <code>setInterval</code> callback liable not be invoked due to CPU constraints?</p>\n<p>It's worth noting that this feature to poll the event state is new <em>(5 days)</em> &amp; I had <strong>never</strong> had an issue with <code>setInterval</code> beforehand <em>(I don't know how much CPU was being used though)</em>. I was initially polling the state every 30 seconds &amp; when I noticed this problem. When I checked <code>docker stats</code>, almost 200% CPU usage was shown. Lowering it to 1 minute instead has fixed that slightly. I have the <a href=\"https://dev.to/akanksha_9560/why-not-to-use-setinterval--2na9\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><code>process.CHECKING_EVENT</code> global bool there to not block the thread</a> &amp; not cause a pile up of tasks on the stack.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":167,"question_id":65030139,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I need to validate a form field.<br />\nthis is the <code>categories</code> field inside my form.</p>\n<pre><code>categories = {\n    category1: [ \n        { id: 1, quantity: 0 },\n        { id: 2, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category2: [ \n        { id: 3, quantity: 0 },\n        { id: 4, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category3: [ \n        { id: 5, quantity: 0 },\n        { id: 6, quantity: 0 }  \n    ]\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>this is how I check if <strong>AT LEAST ONE</strong> array element passes a test inside <strong>EACH</strong> <code>category</code>.</p>\n<pre><code>for (const category in categories) {\n    let theOne = categories[category].some(product =&gt; product.quantity !== 0);\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>this way the form will be valid if at least one <code>quantity</code> inside <strong>EACH</strong> <code>category</code> will hold a value of 1.</p>\n<pre><code>// I DONT WANT THIS\ncategories = {\n    category1: [ \n        { id: 1, quantity: 1 }, // at least one quantity value is 1\n        { id: 2, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category2: [ \n        { id: 3, quantity: 1 }, // at least one quantity value is 1\n        { id: 4, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category3: [ \n        { id: 5, quantity: 1 }, // at least one quantity value is 1\n        { id: 6, quantity: 0 }  \n    ]\n}\n\n\n// I NEED THIS\ncategories = {\n    category1: [ \n        { id: 1, quantity: 1 }, // at least one quantity value is 1\n        { id: 2, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category2: [ \n        { id: 3, quantity: 0 }, // not needed\n        { id: 4, quantity: 0 }\n    ],\n    category3: [ \n        { id: 5, quantity: 0 }, // not needed\n        { id: 6, quantity: 0 }  \n    ]\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>how is it possible to make it work for at least one <code>category</code> ?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":168,"question_id":65030136,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I am using a custom inline editable text area component within a multi-selectable <a href=\"https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/fluentui#/controls/web/detailslist\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Microsoft Fluent UI</a> Details list component.</p>\n<p>Like so:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/2n3Ui.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/2n3Ui.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>I am running into the issue when I am focused within the text area input, the home, end, and arrow keys on the keyboard don't move the cursor; they move the overall accessibility focus to the next checkbox input or button input on the page. I've been looking around for a solution and have had no luck. Do you know a good way to trap the focus so that the home, end, and arrow keys move the cursor within my text area when focused and not to the next table element? Here is the code for the details list and the custom text area:</p>\n<h3>TextArea:</h3>\n<pre><code>export const TextArea = (props: {\n    value: string;\n    placeHolder: string;\n    onChange: (value: string) =&gt; void;\n    showCharacterCounter?: boolean;\n    characterMax?: number;\n    disabled?: boolean;\n}) =&gt; {\n    const textAreaRef = useRef&lt;HTMLTextAreaElement&gt;(null);\n    const [value, setValue] = useState(props.value);\n    const [isFocused, setIsFocused] = useState&lt;boolean&gt;(false);\n    const { classNames, characterCountStyles } = useTextAreaStyles(isFocused);\n    const { placeHolder, showCharacterCounter, characterMax, onChange } = props;\n    const [textAreaHeight, setTextAreaHeight] = useState('auto');\n    const [parentHeight, setParentHeight] = useState('auto');\n\n    useEffect(() =&gt; {\n        setParentHeight(`${textAreaRef.current!.scrollHeight}px`);\n        setTextAreaHeight(`${textAreaRef.current!.scrollHeight}px`);\n    }, [value]);\n\n    return (\n        &lt;Fragment&gt;\n            &lt;div style={{ minHeight: parentHeight }} className={classNames.wrapper}&gt;\n                {/* This may need to be updated to accept rich text in the future to better handle bulleted lists */}\n                &lt;textarea\n                    tabIndex={0}\n                    placeholder={placeHolder}\n                    className={classNames.root}\n                    ref={textAreaRef}\n                    value={value}\n                    onChange={(event) =&gt; {\n                        setTextAreaHeight('auto');\n                        setParentHeight(`${textAreaRef.current!.scrollHeight}px`);\n                        setValue(event.target.value ?? '');\n                    }}\n                    onBlur={\n                        props.value === value\n                            ? () =&gt; setIsFocused(false)\n                            : () =&gt; {\n                                  setIsFocused(false);\n                                  onChange(value);\n                              }\n                    }\n                    onFocus={() =&gt; setIsFocused(true)}\n                    style={{\n                        height: textAreaHeight\n                    }}\n                    maxLength={512}\n                    disabled={props.disabled}\n                /&gt;\n                {showCharacterCounter &amp;&amp; isFocused ? (\n                    &lt;CharacterCounter currentCount={value?.length ?? 0} limit={characterMax ?? 0} styles={characterCountStyles} /&gt;\n                ) : (\n                    &lt;Fragment /&gt;\n                )}\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/Fragment&gt;\n    );\n};\n</code></pre>\n<h3>DetailsList snippet:</h3>\n<pre><code>    const columns = [\n        {\n            name: 'Decisions',\n            key: 'description',\n            fieldName: 'description',\n            styles: { cellName: { color: theme.palette.themePrimary } }\n        },\n        {\n            name: 'Programs',\n            key: 'programs',\n            fieldName: 'programs',\n            styles: { cellName: { color: theme.palette.themePrimary } },\n            minWidth: 307\n        }\n    ] as IColumn[];\n\n    const _selection = new Selection({\n        onSelectionChanged: () =&gt; {\n            var selectedItems = _selection.getSelection();\n            setSelectedDecisions(selectedItems as MeetingTopicDecisionDto[]);\n        }\n    });\n\n    const onRenderRow = (\n        props?: IDetailsRowProps,\n        defaultRender?: (props?: IDetailsRowProps) =&gt; JSX.Element | null\n    ): JSX.Element =&gt; {\n        const propsWithNewStyles = {\n            ...props,\n            styles: {\n                cell: { paddingLeft: rem(9.5) }\n            }\n        } as IDetailsRowProps;\n        return defaultRender!(propsWithNewStyles)!;\n    };\n\n    const renderItemColumn = (item: IMeetingTopicDecisionDto, index?: number, column?: IColumn) =&gt; {\n        const fieldContent = item[column?.fieldName as keyof IMeetingTopicDecisionDto] as string;\n        switch (column?.key) {\n            case 'description':\n                return (\n                    &lt;TextArea\n                        key={item.id}\n                        placeHolder='Enter Decision Description'\n                        value={item.description as string}\n                        characterMax={512}\n                        showCharacterCounter\n                        onChange={(value) =&gt; {\n                            updateMeetingTopicDecision(\n                                { ...item, meetingId: props.meetingTopic?.meetingId, description: value },\n                                { onSuccess: () =&gt; setSelectedDecisions(undefined) }\n                            );\n                        }}\n                        disabled={disableFields}\n                    /&gt;\n                );\n            case 'programs':\n                return (\n                    &lt;div className={classNames.programsSection} key={item.id}&gt;\n                        &lt;div className={classNames.addProgramButtonWrapper}&gt;\n                            &lt;ProgramPicker\n                                key={item.id}\n                                buttonPositionTop={true}\n                                addButtonText={'Add Program'}\n                                tagTheme={TagThemeType.GrayScale}\n                                selectedProgramIds={item.associatedPrograms?.map((x) =&gt; x.programId)}\n                                onAddProgram={(program) =&gt; {\n                                    const nextMeetingTopicDecision: IMeetingTopicDecisionDto = {\n                                        ...item,\n                                        associatedPrograms: item.associatedPrograms ?? []\n                                    };\n                                    nextMeetingTopicDecision.associatedPrograms?.push({\n                                        meetingTopicDecisionId: item.id!,\n                                        programId: program.id!\n                                    } as MeetingTopicDecisionProgramDto);\n                                    updateMeetingTopicDecision({\n                                        ...nextMeetingTopicDecision,\n                                        meetingId: props.meetingTopic?.meetingId\n                                    });\n                                }}\n                                onRemoveProgram={(program) =&gt; {\n                                    const nextMeetingTopicDecision: IMeetingTopicDecisionDto = { ...item };\n                                    const programIndex = nextMeetingTopicDecision.associatedPrograms!.findIndex(\n                                        (x) =&gt; x.programId === program.id\n                                    );\n                                    nextMeetingTopicDecision.associatedPrograms!.splice(programIndex, 1);\n                                    updateMeetingTopicDecision(\n                                        { ...nextMeetingTopicDecision, meetingId: props.meetingTopic?.meetingId },\n                                        {\n                                            onSuccess: () =&gt; setSelectedDecisions(undefined)\n                                        }\n                                    );\n                                }}\n                                disabled={disableFields}\n                                addButtonStyles={addProgramButtonStyles}\n                            /&gt;\n                        &lt;/div&gt;\n                        &lt;IconButton\n                            iconProps={{ iconName: 'More' }}\n                            styles={{ root: { marginRight: rem(10) } }}\n                            onClick={(ev) =&gt; setContextualMenuProps(getContextualMenuProps(ev, column))}\n                            ariaLabel={`Remove meeting decision`}\n                        /&gt;\n                    &lt;/div&gt;\n                );\n            default:\n                return &lt;span&gt;{fieldContent}&lt;/span&gt;;\n        }\n    };\n\n    const getContextualMenuProps = (ev: React.MouseEvent&lt;any&gt;, column: IColumn): IContextualMenuProps =&gt; {\n        const items = [\n            {\n                key: 'delete',\n                name: selectedDecisions?.length! &lt;= 1 ? 'Delete Decision' : 'Delete Rows',\n                iconProps: { iconName: 'Trash' },\n                ariaLabel: selectedDecisions?.length! &lt;= 1 ? 'Delete Decision' : 'Delete Rows',\n                onClick: () =&gt; {\n                    selectedDecisions![0].meetingId = props.meetingTopic?.meetingId;\n\n                    deleteMeetingTopicDecision(selectedDecisions, {\n                        onSuccess: () =&gt; setSelectedDecisions(undefined)\n                    });\n                }\n            }\n        ] as IContextualMenuItem[];\n\n        return {\n            items: items,\n            target: ev.target as any,\n\n            onDismiss: () =&gt; {\n                setContextualMenuProps(undefined);\n            }\n        };\n    };\n\n    const onColumnClick = (ev: React.MouseEvent&lt;HTMLElement&gt;, column: IColumn): void =&gt; {\n        setContextualMenuProps(getContextualMenuProps(ev, column));\n    };\n\n    const onItemContextMenu = (item?: any, index?: number, ev?: any): boolean =&gt; {\n        onColumnClick(ev, columns[index!]);\n        return false;\n    };\n\n    return (\n        &lt;Fragment&gt;\n            &lt;MeetingSubsectionList\n                columns={columns}\n                items={props.meetingTopic?.decisions ?? []}\n                onRenderItemColumn={renderItemColumn}\n                ariaLabelForSelectionColumn='Toggle selection'\n                ariaLabelForSelectAllCheckbox='Toggle selection for all decisions'\n                checkButtonAriaLabel='Row checkbox'\n                styles={{ root: { borderRadius: rem(10) } }}\n                selectionMode={SelectionMode.multiple}\n                onItemContextMenu={onItemContextMenu}\n                enterModalSelectionOnTouch={true}\n                checkboxCellClassName={classNames.checkBoxCell}\n                selection={_selection}\n                contextualMenuProps={contextualMenuProps}\n                onRenderRow={onRenderRow}\n                addButtonOnClick={() =&gt; {\n                    createDecision(\n                        { meetingId: props.meetingTopic?.meetingId, meetingTopicId: props.meetingTopic?.id! },\n                        { onSuccess: () =&gt; setSelectedDecisions(undefined) }\n                    );\n                }}\n            /&gt;\n        &lt;/Fragment&gt;\n    );\n};\n\n\ninterface IMeetingSubsectionProps extends IDetailsListProps {\n    contextualMenuProps: IContextualMenuProps | undefined;\n    addButtonOnClick: () =&gt; void;\n    subSectionStyles?: Partial&lt;MeetingSubsectionStyles&gt;;\n}\n\nexport const MeetingSubsectionList = (props: IMeetingSubsectionProps) =&gt; {\n    const { classNames } = useMeetingSubsectionStyles(props.subSectionStyles);\n\n    return (\n        &lt;Fragment&gt;\n            &lt;div className={classNames.root}&gt;\n                &lt;div className={classNames.tableWrapper}&gt;\n                    &lt;DetailsList {...props} /&gt;\n                    {props.contextualMenuProps &amp;&amp; &lt;ContextualMenu {...props.contextualMenuProps} /&gt;}\n                    &lt;div className={classNames.footer}&gt;\n                        &lt;AddButton\n                            ariaLabel='Add New'\n                            disabled={false}\n                            onClick={props.addButtonOnClick}\n                            className={classNames.addButton}\n                        /&gt;\n                    &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/Fragment&gt;\n    );\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p>Thank you so much for your time.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":170,"question_id":65030108,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>EDIT for the tldr version scroll down to where it says <strong>I'm extremely close in the code below.</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Problem</strong></p>\n<p>I have a basic todo list that when completed will have these qualities:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>When the page loads the form field should be in focus.</li>\n<li>When the user clicks the up/down arrows the items in the list should be selected via a CSS background color change.</li>\n<li>When the user types a new item into the form it should appear in the list to the user.</li>\n<li>When the user types into the form field, an &quot;instant search&quot; is applied to the list and only items that match the search appear. All other features should still work. When the user scrolls using the up/down arrows it should still work regardless of how many items are displayed on the page. If only two items are displayed the user should be able to use the up down arrows to select those two items and the form field focus.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>All items except number 4 seem to work fine. The following code demonstrates items 1-3</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://svelte.dev/repl/214b9c033d1c489e991484d387c267c2?version=3.30.0\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://svelte.dev/repl/214b9c033d1c489e991484d387c267c2?version=3.30.0</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\n    import { onMount } from 'svelte';\n    let clients = [&quot;a Little piggy&quot;,&quot;b little piggy&quot;,&quot;c little piggy&quot;]; \n    let indexVal = -1;\n    let downArrowPress = 40;\n    let upArrowPress = 38;\n    let clientInputTextField = &quot;&quot;;\n    let clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    onMount(function() {\n        clientInputTextField.focus();\n    });\n\n\n    function handleKeydown(event) {\n        if(event.keyCode === upArrowPress) {\n            indexVal-=1;    \n            indexVal = indexVal &lt; 0 ?  clients.length : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(event.keyCode === downArrowPress) {\n            indexVal+=1;\n            indexVal = indexVal &gt; clients.length ?  0 : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(indexVal &gt; clients.length -1 || indexVal &lt; 0){\n            clientInputTextField.focus(); \n        } else {\n            clientInputTextField.blur()\n        }   \n    }\n    \n    function handleSubmit(e) {\n        const value = e.target.input.value;\n        console.log(value);\n        clients = [...clients, value];\n        clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    }\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n\n\n&lt;svelte:window on:keydown={handleKeydown}/&gt;\n\n&lt;form on:submit|preventDefault={handleSubmit}&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;input&quot; bind:this={clientInputTextField}  bind:value={clientVal} autocomplete=&quot;off&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;submit&quot; name=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n&lt;ul&gt;\n    {#each clients as client, i}\n        {#if i === indexVal}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;background-color:orange&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n            {:else}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n        {/if}\n    {/each}\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n\n\n\n\n&lt;!-- \n\nfunction search(e){\n    console.log(e.target.value)\n    const searchString = e.target.value.toLowerCase();\n    const filteredCharacters = clients.filter((character) =&gt; {\n        return (\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString) ||\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString)\n        );\n    });\n    \n     console.log(filteredCharacters)\n}\n --&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>I want to marry the above code with an instant search feature.</p>\n<pre><code>function search(e){\n    console.log(e.target.value)\n    const searchString = e.target.value.toLowerCase();\n    const filteredCharacters = clients.filter((character) =&gt; {\n        return (\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString) ||\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString)\n        );\n    });\n    \n     console.log(filteredCharacters)\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Everything I've tried so far just makes a mess, does not return the list and unfocuses (onBlur) the input field.</p>\n<p>The code below console.log's an array that gives me what I want as the user searches. Everything I've tried so far has not worked.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://svelte.dev/repl/ceca685a3a4c49b4b5ccd780a101fc63?version=3.30.0\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://svelte.dev/repl/ceca685a3a4c49b4b5ccd780a101fc63?version=3.30.0</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\n    import { onMount } from 'svelte';\n    let clients = [&quot;a Little piggy&quot;,&quot;b little piggy&quot;,&quot;c little piggy&quot;]; \n    let indexVal = -1;\n    let downArrowPress = 40;\n    let upArrowPress = 38;\n    let clientInputTextField = &quot;&quot;;\n    let clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    onMount(function() {\n        clientInputTextField.focus();\n    });\n\n\n    function search(e){\n    console.log(e.target.value)\n    const searchString = e.target.value.toLowerCase();\n    const filteredCharacters = clients.filter((character) =&gt; {\n        return (\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString) ||\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString)\n        );\n    });\n    \n     console.log(filteredCharacters)\n    \n    }\n\n\n    function handleKeydown(event) {\n        if(event.keyCode === upArrowPress) {\n            indexVal-=1;    \n            indexVal = indexVal &lt; 0 ?  clients.length : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(event.keyCode === downArrowPress) {\n            indexVal+=1;\n            indexVal = indexVal &gt; clients.length ?  0 : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(indexVal &gt; clients.length -1 || indexVal &lt; 0){\n            clientInputTextField.focus(); \n        } else {\n            clientInputTextField.blur()\n        }   \n    }\n    \n    function handleSubmit(e) {\n        const value = e.target.input.value;\n        console.log(value);\n        clients = [...clients, value];\n        clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    }\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n\n\n&lt;svelte:window on:keydown={handleKeydown}/&gt;\n\n&lt;form on:submit|preventDefault={handleSubmit}&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;input&quot; bind:this={clientInputTextField}  bind:value={clientVal} on:input={search} autocomplete=&quot;off&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;submit&quot; name=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n&lt;ul&gt;\n    {#each clients as client, i}\n        {#if i === indexVal}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;background-color:orange&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n            {:else}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n        {/if}\n    {/each}\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n\n\n\n\n&lt;!-- \n\n\n --&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>EDIT</strong></p>\n<p><strong>I'm extremely close in the code below.</strong></p>\n<p>In this version, the only problem is that when a user submits a new todo the list does not appear in the DOM. Everything else behind the scenes works. To see what I mean, add an item to the input field, submit it and then type the letter a in the form field and then hit the back space button. The list will reappear.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://svelte.dev/repl/f8fb733401eb4e27b9b8e54c688d355a?version=3.30.0\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://svelte.dev/repl/f8fb733401eb4e27b9b8e54c688d355a?version=3.30.0</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\n    import { onMount } from 'svelte';\n    let clients = [&quot;a Little piggy&quot;,&quot;b little piggy&quot;,&quot;c little piggy&quot;]; \n    let clientsCopy = [...clients];\n    let indexVal = -1;\n    let downArrowPress = 40;\n    let upArrowPress = 38;\n    let clientInputTextField = &quot;&quot;;\n    let clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    onMount(function() {\n        clientInputTextField.focus();\n    });\n\n\n    function search(e){\n    console.log(e.target.value)\n    const searchString = e.target.value.toLowerCase();\n    const filteredCharacters = clients.filter((character) =&gt; {\n        return (\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString) ||\n            character.toLowerCase().includes(searchString)\n        );\n    });\n    \n     clientsCopy = [...filteredCharacters]\n    \n    }\n\n\n    function handleKeydown(event) {\n        if(event.keyCode === upArrowPress) {\n            indexVal-=1;    \n            indexVal = indexVal &lt; 0 ?  clientsCopy.length : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(event.keyCode === downArrowPress) {\n            indexVal+=1;\n            indexVal = indexVal &gt; clientsCopy.length ?  0 : indexVal\n            console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(indexVal &gt; clientsCopy.length -1 || indexVal &lt; 0){\n            clientInputTextField.focus(); \n        } else {\n            clientInputTextField.blur()\n        }   \n    }\n    \n    function handleSubmit(e) {\n        const value = e.target.input.value;\n        console.log(value);\n        clients = [...clients, value];\n        clientVal = &quot;&quot;;\n    }\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n\n\n&lt;svelte:window on:keydown={handleKeydown}/&gt;\n\n&lt;form on:submit|preventDefault={handleSubmit}&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;input&quot; bind:this={clientInputTextField}  bind:value={clientVal} on:input={search} autocomplete=&quot;off&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;submit&quot; name=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n&lt;ul&gt;\n    {#each clientsCopy as client, i}\n        {#if i === indexVal}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;background-color:orange&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n            {:else}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n        {/if}\n    {/each}\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n\n\n\n\n&lt;!-- \n\n\n --&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":174,"question_id":65030010,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Hello this is my first question here and I am just a beginner in Reactjs I need your explanation, please</p>\n<p>the code is about Controlled Form wrote in-class component using &quot;this.state&quot;.</p>\n<p>I was trying time to turn it into a functional component using hooks with the same results\n1- onSubmit render text on the screen\n2- reset input into &quot;&quot;</p>\n<p>the problem is no results going write and instead I got [object, Object] in the search</p>\n<p>this is code</p>\n<pre><code>class MyForm extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props) {\n    super(props);\n    this.state = {\n      input: '',\n      submit: ''\n    };\n    this.handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this);\n    this.handleSubmit = this.handleSubmit.bind(this);\n  }\n  handleChange(event) {\n    this.setState({\n      input: event.target.value\n    });\n  }\n  handleSubmit(event) {\n    event.preventDefault()\n    this.setState({\n      submit: this.state.input,\n      input:''\n    })\n  }\n  render() {\n    return (\n      &lt;div&gt;\n        &lt;form onSubmit={this.handleSubmit}&gt;\n        &lt;input type='text' \n          value={this.state.input} \n          onChange={this.handleChange}\n          /&gt;\n          &lt;button type='submit'&gt;Submit!&lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;/form&gt;\n        &lt;h1&gt;{this.state.submit}&lt;/h1&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    );\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p><a href=\"https://codesandbox.io/s/suspicious-brown-437q7?file=/src/App.js\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">The code at codesandbox for fast access</a>\nplease can you tell me how to solve it?\nthank you</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":175,"question_id":65029952,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Learning react</p>\n<p>Trying to loop through an object from an API call that returns a json object and display it but struggling to implement it</p>\n<p>This is the component that should render it</p>\n<pre><code>    export default class ProfilePage extends Component {\n  constructor() {\n    super();\n    this.state = { data: '' };\n  }\n\n  mapObject(object, callback) {\n    return Object.keys(object).map(function (key) {\n        return callback(key, object[key]);\n      })\n\n  }\n\n  async componentDidMount() {\n    const response = await fetch(`https://indapi.kumba.io/webdev/assignment`);\n    const json = await response.json();\n    // console.log(json)\n    this.setState({ data: json });\n    \n  }\n\n  \n\n  render() {\n    const data = this.state.data\n    console.log(data)\n    return (\n      &lt;div className=&quot;row&quot;&gt;\n          {Object.values(data).map(data =&gt; {\n              &lt;div key={key}&gt;\n                {data[key]}\n              &lt;/div&gt;\n          })\n\n          }\n         Woerkkk please\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n    \n    );\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>All I'm getting is a blank screen.</p>\n<p>in the console i get the error <strong>'key' is not defined  no-undef</strong></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":176,"question_id":65029950,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm trying to get the JSON data from the website <a href=\"https://api.cryptonator.com/api/ticker/btc-usd\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://api.cryptonator.com/api/ticker/btc-usd</a></p>\n<p>How would I go about using Javascript to extract the JSON data? Specifically I would want the price field to be outputted.</p>\n<p>For a little context, I'm making a small Crypto project that tracks prices in real time so I would be using it with HTML like so:</p>\n<pre><code>    &lt;h1&gt; Bitcoin (BTC) &lt;/h1&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt; Price in USD: $&lt;span id=&quot;price&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n\n    &lt;/p&gt;\n    &lt;script&gt;\n      const api_url = 'https://api.cryptonator.com/api/ticker/btc-usd';\n\n      async function getBTCPrice() {\n        const response = await fetch(api_url);\n        const data = await response.json();\n\n        console.log(data.ticker.price);\n\n        const price = data.ticker.price;\n\n        document.getElementById('price').textContext = price;\n      }\n\n      getBTCPrice();\n    &lt;/script&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Where the Price in USD (Real-time): $ would update based on the price in the API.</p>\n<p>Any help would be appreciated, thanks!</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":177,"question_id":65029926,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>While being a web developer for over 3 years, I now realize that I know nothing about browsers and that they can differ in many aspects from each other as day &amp; night. As an illustration to this,- I've tried to construct somewhat a &quot;fair-test&quot; for profiling a JavaScript parity check code, which version of it runs faster, this <code>x =&gt; (x%2)==0</code> or that <code>x =&gt; (x&amp;1)==0</code>.\n<br>I suspect that checking only right-most bit, should be faster way, but in a browser world ... you may never know. Here's a complete JavaScript test code :</p>\n<pre><code>function evaluateSpeed(func) {\n    const times = 100000000;\n    const salt = 96145;\n    let check = salt;\n    for (let i = 0; i &lt; times; i++) {\n        check ^= salt + (i&amp;0xff)&lt;&lt;(1+func(i));\n    }\n    return check;\n}\n\nfunction evenStd() {\n    return evaluateSpeed(x =&gt; (x%2)==0);\n}\n\nfunction evenEff() {\n    return evaluateSpeed(x =&gt; (x&amp;1)==0);\n}\n\nfunction test() {\n    let y1 = evenStd();\n    let y2 = evenEff();\n    if (y1 !== y2) {\n        throw new Error('Semantic error !');\n    }\n    else {\n        document.write(&quot;Test is done !&quot;);\n    }\n}\ntest();\n</code></pre>\n<p>And here is the profiling results in a Chromium web browser :</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/PPFH2.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/PPFH2.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>To my surprise function <code>evenEff()</code> (bit-checking function) runs 15x <strong>slower</strong> than <code>evenStd()</code> (modulus division by 2 function) in Chromium ! Here's a profiling results of same code in a Firefox browser :</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/OuyC3.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/OuyC3.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>In a Firefox I see expected results, that <code>evenEff()</code> runs about 2x <strong>faster</strong> than alternative version <code>evenStd()</code>. Here comes the question, What's going on under the hood of a Chromium web browser? Why such weird results? Is it related to code caching? Maybe the remainder operator is better offloaded to GPU cores in Chromium case or something? Or maybe just test isn't fair enough and not cross-browser compatible?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":178,"question_id":65029918,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm making a build script for my angular app in node. Please have a look at the snippet:</p>\n<pre><code>const fs = require('fs-extra');\n\nconst dev = process.argv[2] === 'dev';\nconst folder = process.argv[3];\n\nif (folder &amp;&amp; fs.existsSync(`./projects/${folder}`)) {\n    \n    const execSync = require('child_process').execSync;\n    // ng build --prod --output-hashing=none OR ng build --source-map --output-hashing=none\n    \n    let command;\n    if (dev) {\n        command = 'ng build --source-map --output-hashing=none ' + folder;\n    } else {\n        command = 'ng build --prod --output-hashing=none ' + folder;\n    }\n\n    // execSync(command, {stdio:[0, 1, 2]});\n\n    (async function build()\n        {\n            \n            const files = [\n            ];\n            const { promisify } = require('util')\n\n            const getFiles = async () =&gt; {\n                try {\n                    const readdir = promisify(fs.readdir);\n                    await readdir(`./dist/${folder}`, {withFileTypes:true}, (err, elements) =&gt; {\n                        //handling error\n                        if (err) {\n                            return console.error('Unable to scan directory: ' + err);\n                        } else {\n                            elements.forEach(async element =&gt; {\n                                if( !element.isDirectory() &amp;&amp; /.*-es2015.js$/.test(element.name) ) {\n                                    files.push(`./dist/${folder}/${element.name}`);\n                                    console.log(`Pushing file: ./dist/${folder}/${element.name}`);\n                                }\n                            });\n                        }\n                    });\n                } catch (err) {\n                    console.error(err);\n                }\n            }\n            \n            await getFiles();\n\n            // We need a random number for voiding the cache with every new build\n            const random = [...Array(10)].map(()=&gt;(c = (r = Math.random()).toString(36)[2]) &amp;&amp; r&gt;.5 ? c.toUpperCase():c ).join('');\n\n            // create directory if doesnt exists (not needed anymore): await fs.ensureDir(`../js/${folder}/dist`)\n            if (!dev &amp;&amp; files.length) {\n                const concat = require('concat');\n                await concat(files, `./dist/${folder}/concatenated.${random}.js`);\n            }\n            console.log('Build complete');\n        }\n    )();\n    \n} else if (folder &amp;&amp; !fs.existsSync(`projects/${folder}`)) {\n    console.log('Specified destination folder does not exists as a project');\n}\nelse {\n    console.log('Please specify a destination folder such as app-name');\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Well, the mysterious is that just after await getFiles() call, the execution halts, no error neither message anywhere is shown. I'm getting crazy investigating this.</p>\n<p>Can anybody spot the issue?\nThanks</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":179,"question_id":65029908,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Having another problem with my code, still new to Javascript and routes, I am trying to get a picture with postman into my database, hope this clear up what I am trying to achive:</p>\n<pre><code>//routes.js\nroutes.post('/file/:id', upload.single('file'), async (req,res) =&gt; {\n    const file = req.file; //Uppladdad fil\n    //Hämta filändelse\n    const exts = req.file.originalname.split('.');\n    const fileEnd = exts[exts.length - 1];\n    //Skapa vårt filnamn\n    const fileName = req.body.filename + '.' + fileEnd;\n    try {\n        //Flytta vår fil\n        const id = req.params.id;\n        const image = await dbService.addImage(fileName,id)\n        const filewrite = await fs.rename(file.path, fileName);\n        //Om inget fel skicka ok\n        if(!filewrite) {\n            res.json({'status' : 'ok '});\n        }\n        else {\n            throw error;\n        }\n    } catch(error) { //Fånga våra fel\n        await fs.unlink(file.path); //Ta bort temporär fil\n        res.status(400).json(error);\n    }\n});\n\n//SQLite.sql\nDROP TABLE IF EXISTS products;\nCREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS products (\n    name varchar(32) NOT NULL,\n    description varchar(200) NOT NULL,\n    price INTEGER(10000) NOT NULL,\n    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT NOT NULL UNIQUE,\n    image varchar(90));\n\nINSERT INTO products (name,description,price,image) VALUES\n    ('Boll', 'Fotboll', 50),\n    ('Redbull', 'Ger dig vingar', 20),\n    ('Snickers', 'Choklad', 10)\n\n//database.js\nconst addImage = async (fileName,id) =&gt; {\n    try\n    {\n        const dbCon = await dbPromise;\n        await dbCon.run('INSERT INTO products (image) VALUES (?) {"body":"<p>I'm trying to open a client-side file on my website, but I think because the <code>eventListener('change' readfile)</code> is being added before the JS loads, I can use any of my other JS functions inside <code>readfile(evt)</code></p>\n<p>For some context I'm using an Angular framework at this is one of my service files.</p>\n<p>When I run the code below I get this error <code>ERROR TypeError: this.printData is not a function at HTMLInputElement.readFile</code></p>\n<pre><code>projectName: string; \n\n  openProject() {\n    const fileOpen = document.createElement('input');\n    fileOpen.setAttribute('id', 'file');\n    fileOpen.setAttribute('type', 'file');\n    fileOpen.setAttribute('name', 'file'); \n    fileOpen.setAttribute('enctype', 'multipart/form-data'); \n    fileOpen.click(); \n    fileOpen.addEventListener('change', this.readFile, false);\n\n  } // openProject\n\n  readFile (evt) {\n    let newData = [];\n    let newDataString; \n\n    var files = evt.target.files;\n    var file = files[0];           \n    var reader = new FileReader();\n\n    const result = new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {\n     reader.onload = function(event) {\n       resolve(event.target.result); \n     }\n   }).then(r =&gt; {\n     newDataString = r.toString(); \n     newData = newDataString.split(&quot; &quot;); \n     this.projectName = newData[0];\n\n   }); \n   this.printData();  \n   reader.readAsText(file);\n } // readFile\n\n printData() {\n  console.log(`Name: ${this.projectName}`); \n  } // printData\n</code></pre>\n<p>I'm wondering if anyone can help me find a way to add a <code>changeListener</code> that runs a function that has access to the rest of the variables, and functions in the file. {"body":"<p>I am trying to create a form that takes in contact details. with undefined again but still able to edit the DB  <a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/zvMVk.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">undefined elements for edit</a></p>\n<p>I Think  the <code>displayItems</code> js at the bottom is where I am Making my mistake</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const uri = 'api/ContactsItems';\nlet MyContacts = [];\n\nfunction getItems() {\n    fetch(uri)\n        .then(response =&gt; response.json())\n        .then(data =&gt; _displayItems(data))\n        .catch(error =&gt; console.error('Unable to get items.', error));\n}\n\nfunction addItem() {\n    \n    const addFirstNameTextbox = document.getElementById('add-FirstName');\n    const addLastNameTextbox = document.getElementById('add-LastName');\n    const addPhoneTextbox = document.getElementById('add-Phone');\n    const addEmailTextbox = document.getElementById('add-Email');\n    const addJobTitleTextbox = document.getElementById('add-JobTitle');\n    const addCompanyTextbox = document.getElementById('add-Company');\n    const addCityTextbox = document.getElementById('add-City');\n    const addCountryTextbox = document.getElementById('add-Country');\n    \n   \n\n    const item = {\n        FirstName: addFirstNameTextbox.value.trim(),\n        LastName: addLastNameTextbox.value.trim(),\n        Phone: addPhoneTextbox.value.trim(),\n        Email: addEmailTextbox.value.trim(),\n        JobTitle: addJobTitleTextbox.value.trim(),\n        Company: addCompanyTextbox.value.trim(),\n        City: addCityTextbox.value.trim(),\n        Country: addCountryTextbox.value.trim()\n    };\n    fetch(uri, {\n        method: 'POST',\n        headers: {\n            'Accept': 'application/json',\n            'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n        },\n        body: JSON.stringify(item)\n    })\n        .then(response =&gt; response.json())\n        .then(() =&gt; {\n            getItems();\n            addFirstNameTextbox.value = '',\n            addLastNameTextbox.value = '',\n            addPhoneTextbox.value = '',\n            addEmailTextbox.value = '',\n            addJobTitleTextbox.value = '',\n            addCompanyTextbox.value = '',\n            addCityTextbox.value = '',\n            addCountryTextbox.value = '';\n        })\n        .catch(error =&gt; console.error('Unable to add item.', error));\n\n    \n}\nfunction deleteItem(id) {\n    fetch(`${uri}/${id}`, {\n        method: 'DELETE'\n    })\n        .then(() =&gt; getItems())\n        .catch(error =&gt; console.error('Unable to delete item.', error));\n}\nfunction displayEditForm(id) {\n    const item = MyContacts.find(item =&gt; item.id === id);\n    document.getElementById('edit-FirstName').value = item.FirstName;\n    document.getElementById('edit-id').value = item.id;\n    document.getElementById('edit-LastName').value = item.LastName;\n    document.getElementById('edit-Phone').value = item.Phone;\n    document.getElementById('edit-Email').value = item.Email;\n    document.getElementById('edit-JobTitle').value = item.JobTitle;\n    document.getElementById('edit-Company').value = item.Company;\n    document.getElementById('edit-City').value = item.City;\n    document.getElementById('edit-Country').value = item.Country;\n    document.getElementById('editForm').style.display = 'inline';\n}\n\nfunction updateItem() {\n    const itemId = document.getElementById('edit-id').value;\n    const item = {\n        id: parseInt(itemId, 10),\n        FirstName: document.getElementById('edit-FirstName').value.trim(),\n        LastName: document.getElementById('edit-LastName').value.trim(),\n        Phone: document.getElementById('edit-Phone').value.trim(),\n        Email: document.getElementById('edit-Email').value.trim(),\n        JobTitle: document.getElementById('edit-JobTitle').value.trim(),\n        Company: document.getElementById('edit-Company').value.trim(),\n        City: document.getElementById('edit-City').value.trim(),\n        Country: document.getElementById('edit-Country').value.trim()\n\n    };\n    fetch(`${uri}/${itemId}`, {\n        method: 'PUT',\n        headers: {\n            'Accept': 'application/json',\n            'Content-Type': 'application/json'\n        },\n        body: JSON.stringify(item)\n    })\n        .then(() =&gt; getItems())\n        .catch(error =&gt; console.error('Unable to delete item.', error));\n\n    closeInput();\n\n    return false;\n}\nfunction _displayItems(data) {\n    const tBody = document.getElementById('MyContacts');\n    tBody.innerHTML = '';\n\n    _displayCount(data.length);\n\n    const button = document.createElement('button');\n\n    data.forEach(item =&gt; {\n        let editButton = button.cloneNode(false);\n        editButton.innerText = 'Edit';\n        editButton.setAttribute('onclick', `displayEditForm(${item.id})`);\n\n        let deleteButton = button.cloneNode(false);\n        deleteButton.innerText = 'Delete';\n        deleteButton.setAttribute('onclick', `deleteItem(${item.id})`);\n\n        let tr = tBody.insertRow();\n\n        let td1 = tr.insertCell(0);\n        let FirstNametextNode = document.createTextNode(item.FirstName);\n        td1.appendChild(FirstNametextNode);\n\n        let td2 = tr.insertCell(1);\n        let LastNametextNode = document.createTextNode(item.LastName);\n        td2.appendChild(LastNametextNode);\n\n        let td3 = tr.insertCell(2);\n        let PhonetextNode = document.createTextNode(item.Phone);\n        td3.appendChild(PhonetextNode);\n\n        let td4 = tr.insertCell(3);\n        let EmailtextNode = document.createTextNode(item.Email);\n        td4.appendChild(EmailtextNode);\n\n        let td5 = tr.insertCell(4);\n        let JobTitletextNode = document.createTextNode(item.JobTitle);\n        td5.appendChild(JobTitletextNode);\n\n        let td6 = tr.insertCell(5);\n        let CompanytextNode = document.createTextNode(item.Company);\n        td6.appendChild(CompanytextNode);\n\n        let td7 = tr.insertCell(6);\n        let CitytextNode = document.createTextNode(item.City);\n        td7.appendChild(CitytextNode);\n\n        let td8 = tr.insertCell(7);\n        let CountrytextNode = document.createTextNode(item.Country);\n        td8.appendChild(CountrytextNode);\n\n        let td9 = tr.insertCell(8);\n        td9.appendChild(editButton);\n\n        let td10 = tr.insertCell(9);\n        td10.appendChild(deleteButton);\n    });\n\n    MyContacts = data;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n      &lt;meta charset=\"utf-8\" /&gt;\n      &lt;title&gt;Contact List&lt;/title&gt;\n      &lt;link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"css/site.css\" /&gt;\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;h1&gt;Contact List Management Application&lt;/h1&gt;\n        &lt;h3&gt;Add New Contact&lt;/h3&gt;\n        &lt;form action=\"javascript:void(0);\"  method=\"POST\" onsubmit=\"addItem()\"&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;First Name:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;input type=\"text\" id=\"add-FirstName\" &gt;\n          &lt;p&gt;Email:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;input type=\"text\" id=\"add-Email\" &gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;Job Title:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;input type=\"text\" id=\"add-JobTitle\"&gt;\n Here is my code:</p>\n<pre><code>const Commando = require('discord.js-commando')\n\nmodule.exports = class NicknameCommand extends Commando.Command {\n    constructor(client) {\n        super(client, {\n            name: 'nickname',\n            aliases: ['nick'],\n            group: 'misc',\n            memberName: 'nickname',\n            userPermissions: [\n                'MANAGE_NICKNAMES',\n                'CHANGE_NICKNAME'\n            ],\n            clientPermissions: [\n                'MANAGE_NICKNAMES',\n                'CHANGE_NICKNAME'\n            ],\n            description: 'Changes the nickname of a user',\n            argsType: 'multiple'\n        })\n    }\n\n    run = (message, args) =&gt; {\n        const target = message.mentions.users.first()\n\n        if(!target) {\n            return message.reply('Please specify a valid member to change the nickname of')\n        }\n\n        if(message.member.roles.highest.position &lt; target.roles.highest.position) {\n            return message.channel.send('You do not have a high enough role to change this member\\'s nickname')\n        }\n        if(message.guild.me.roles.highest.position &lt; target.roles.highest.position) {\n            return message.channel.send('I do not have a high enough role to change this member\\'s nickname')\n        }\n\n        const member = message.guild.members.cache.get(target.id)\n        \n        args.shift()\n        const nickname = args.join(' ')\n\n        if(nickname.length &gt; 32) {\n            return message.reply('That nickname is too long! {"body":"<p>using <a href=\"https://pythonise.com/categories/javascript/infinite-lazy-loading\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">this guide</a>, I am trying to create a page with infinite scrolling. Here is the Python code:</p>\n<pre><code>def calculate(counter):\n    # Other parts of the code...\n    i = counter\n    if counter not in range (len(list_of_dictionaries)):\n        return\n    dict1 = list_of_dictionaries(i)\n    return (dict1)\n\n\n@app.route('/load')\ndef load():\n    if request.args:\n        counter = int(request.args.get(&quot;c&quot;))\n    dict1 = calculate(counter)\n    res = make_response(dict1)\n    return res\n</code></pre>\n<p>and this is the JS code in the <code>load.html</code> code (sorry it's a bit too big):</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\nvar scroller = document.querySelector(&quot;#scroller&quot;);\nvar template = document.querySelector('#post_template');\nvar loaded = document.querySelector(&quot;#loaded&quot;);\nvar sentinel = document.querySelector('#sentinel');\n\n// Set a counter to count the items loaded\nvar counter = 0;\n\n// Function to request new items and render to the dom\nfunction loadItems() {\n\n  // Use fetch to request data and pass the counter value in the QS\n  fetch(`/load?c=${counter}`).then((response) =&gt; {\n\n    // Convert the response data to JSON\n    response.json().then((data) =&gt; {\n\n      // If empty JSON, exit the function\n      if (!data.length) {\n\n        // Replace the spinner with &quot;No more posts&quot;\n        sentinel.innerHTML = &quot;No more posts&quot;;\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Iterate over the items in the response\n      for (var i = 0; i &lt; data.length; i++) {\n\n        // Clone the HTML template\n        let template_clone = template.content.cloneNode(true);\n\n        // Query &amp; update the template content\n        template_clone.querySelector(&quot;#title&quot;).innerHTML = `${data[i][0]}: ${data[i][1]}`;\n        template_clone.querySelector(&quot;#content&quot;).innerHTML = data[i][2];\n\n        // Append template to dom\n        scroller.appendChild(template_clone);\n\n        // Increment the counter\n        counter += 1;\n\n        // Update the counter in the navbar\n        loaded.innerText = `${counter} items loaded`;\n\n      }\n    })\n  })\n}\n\n// Create a new IntersectionObserver instance\nvar intersectionObserver = new IntersectionObserver(entries =&gt; {\n\n  // Uncomment below to see the entry.intersectionRatio when\n  // the sentinel comes into view\n\n  // entries.forEach(entry =&gt; {\n  //   console.log(entry.intersectionRatio);\n  // })\n\n  \n  if (entries[0].intersectionRatio &lt;= 0) {\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // Call the loadItems function\n  loadItems();\n\n});\n\n// Instruct the IntersectionObserver to watch the sentinel\nintersectionObserver.observe(sentinel);\n&lt;/script&gt;&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>I didn't copy the HTML part here because that seems to be fine. {"body":"<p>I receive a JSON object through an HTTP request.I just want to check if that object has <em>only</em> the fields that I want, don't need to check their value.\nI did this:</p>\n<pre><code>function checkObject(o1, o2) {\n  for (const p1 in o1) {\n     for (const p2 in o2) {\n      if (o1.hasOwnProperty(p2) === false) {\n        return false;\n      }\n      if (o2.hasOwnProperty(p1) === false) {\n        return false;\n      }\n    }\n   }\n  return true;\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>This is the valid object. {"body":"<p><strong>My Situation</strong></p>\n<p>I am developing a PWA with reactjs.\nTherefore I had to add a manifest file with a <code>start_url</code>.\nEvery user has its own directory, e.g. <code>www.example.com/user_id/...</code>.</p>\n<p>I would like to add the <code>user_id</code> as part of the <code>start_url</code>, in order to always start the installed PWA on the user-specific part of the website.</p>\n<p><strong>Solutions I thought of</strong></p>\n<p>At first I tried to omit the <code>start_url</code>, in this case it seems like the &quot;bookmarked&quot; is used as the <code>start_url</code> instead. The only problem is that a <code>start_url</code> is mandatory in order to make the website installable.</p>\n<p>A working solution might be to replace <code>index.html</code> and <code>manifest.json</code> by php-files and declaring them like this:</p>\n<pre><code>// index.php\n// ...\n&lt;link rel=&quot;manifest&quot; href=&quot;/manifest.php?user_id=&lt;extracted_from_current_location&gt;&quot;&gt;\n// ...\n</code></pre>\n<p>and letting <strong>manifest.php</strong> return a <code>.json</code> file with a <code>start_url</code> including the passed value for <code>user_id</code>.</p>\n<p><strong>My Problem</strong></p>\n<p>The solution above feels totally like a workaround. I am not pretty good in php and therefore it feels unsafe too. Is there another way, maybe using javascript?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":207,"question_id":65029193,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I am currently working on a little Website where a user can put a &quot;filter&quot; over his picture. All this is purely driven by JS - So no security problems for my server there.</p>\n<p>But now I want to save the pictures onto my server (only after confirmation of the user) to later use it in another project. As I am not very skilled in PHP I wanted to ensure that this script is save for my Server.</p>\n<p>I use a Ajax Code to trigger the upload to the Server:</p>\n<pre><code>function save_to_server(){\n    dataURL = canvas.toDataURL();\n\n    $.ajax({ \n        type: &quot;POST&quot;, \n        url: &quot;upload.php&quot;, \n        data: {  \n            imgBase64: dataURL \n        } \n    }).done(function(o) { \n        console.log('saved');  \n    });\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Then I decode the Base64 and save it with a random name:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;?php   \n    define('UPLOAD_DIR', 'images/');   \n    $img = $_POST['imgBase64'];   \n    $img = str_replace('data:image/png;base64,', '', $img);   \n    $img = str_replace(' ', '+', $img);   \n    $data = base64_decode($img);   \n    $file = UPLOAD_DIR . uniqid() . '.png';   \n    $success = file_put_contents($file, $data);   \n    print $success ? $file : 'Unable to save the file.';   \n?&gt;   \n</code></pre>\n<p>I plan to connect a SQL Database where I save a md5 of each file to check for someone uploading the same image over and over (and to keep track of the images of course). {"body":"<p>I am using React / Redux for my app. In my app I wish to mount and render modals.\nTo accommodate this I created a <code>modal</code> reducer to store modal properties.</p>\n<pre><code>modal : {\n  isOpen: false,\n  type: GENERIC\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>I have also created a <code>MyModal</code> component that takes <code>isModalOpen</code> as a property.\n<code>MyModal</code> also accepts a function (<code>setModalState</code>) for the <code>onClick</code> event to set <code>modal.isOpen</code> to false in Redux state on close. The <code>MyModal</code> component uses <code>ReactDOM.createPortal()</code> to create the modal in a separate div element.</p>\n<pre><code>const MyModal = ({ isOpen, id='', el='div', onClick}) =&gt; {\n  const [container] = useState(document.createElement(el))\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    document.body.appendChild(container)\n    return () =&gt; { document.body.removeChild(container) } // Cleanup function\n  }, [isOpen])\n\n  if (isOpen) {\n    return ReactDOM.createPortal(\n      &lt;div&gt;\n        &lt;p&gt;you clicked {id}&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;button onClick={onClick}&gt;Close modal&lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    , container)\n  } else return null;\n}\n\nconst mapStateToProps = (state, props) =&gt; {\n  return { isOpen: state.modal.isOpen }\n}\n\nexport default connect(mapStateToProps)(MyModal)\n</code></pre>\n<p>The modal can be opened from many components. I wish for the app to re-render as little as possible (always a good thing, right!).</p>\n<p>I wish to use the modal in a list of elements and be able to open the modal <em><strong>from each element</strong></em>.</p>\n<pre><code>export const NoteList = (props) =&gt; {\n\n  const handleModal = (e, id) =&gt; {\n    if (props.isOpen) { return } //exit if true\n    e.preventDefault()\n    const closeToPageBottom = (e.nativeEvent.pageY &gt; (window.innerHeight - 120))\n    if (closeToPageBottom) {\n      setContextMenuPosition({ x: e.nativeEvent.pageX + menuOffsetX, y: e.nativeEvent.pageY - 115 }) // Menu position\n      props.setModalState(id, contextMenuPosition)\n    } else {\n      setContextMenuPosition({ x: e.nativeEvent.pageX + menuOffsetX, y: e.nativeEvent.pageY }) // Menu position\n      props.setModalState(id, contextMenuPosition)\n    }\n  }\n\n  return (\n    props.notesArray.map((note)=&gt;{ return &lt;NoteItem key={note.id} handleModalClick={handleModal}&gt; })\n    &lt;MyModal onClick={setModalState} isOpen={isOpen} /&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nconst mapStateToProps = (state, props) =&gt; { \n  isOpen: state.modal.isOpen,\n  notesArray: state.notes\n}\n  \nconst mapDispatchToProps = (dispatch) = {\n  setModalState: (id, position) =&gt; dispatch(toggleModal({ id, position, type: GENERIC }))\n}\n\nexport default connect(mapStateToProps, mapDispatchToProps)(NoteList)\n</code></pre>\n<p>This approach works, but I have found that the <code>NoteList</code> component re-renders each time I open or close a modal - since the component listens to <code>modal.isOpen</code>. I have tried to mount <code>MyModal</code> in each <code>NoteItem</code> instead, but that means <code>MyModal</code> will be mounted 40 times (once for each <code>NoteItem</code>) and return null - <em><strong>which seems ineffective</strong></em>.</p>\n<p>Is there a way to mount <code>MyModal</code> <strong>once</strong> without re-rendering <code>NoteList</code>?\nOr is there a better approach to handle modals?</p>\n<p>Ideally I would like for <code>MyModal</code> only to mount when <code>modal.isOpen</code> === true.</p>\n<p>Kind regards (^__^)/K</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":217,"question_id":65029037,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm using <a href=\"https://github.com/angular/dgeni\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">dgeni</a> to extract jsDoc tags from a javascript codebase and generate markdown documentation files.</p>\n<p>Dgeni workflow relies of the concept of pipelining. In dgeni this means that you can define a list of &quot;processors&quot; (i.e., functions) that are run in sequence, one after the other and the output of any processor is given as input to the next one. Each processor contributes to the making of the final list of docs which gets saved to the hard disk by one of those processor (placed nearly at the end of that sequence).</p>\n<p>E.g., this is the &quot;default&quot; sequence of processors when the packages <code>base</code>, <code>jsdoc</code> and <code>nunjucks</code> from <a href=\"https://github.com/angular/dgeni-packages\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">dgeni-packages</a> are loaded in a dgeni instance:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-sh prettyprint-override\"><code>info:    1: reading-files (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    2: readFilesProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    3: files-read (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    4: extractJSDocCommentsProcessor   from  jsdoc\ninfo:    5: parsing-tags (abstract)  from  jsdoc\ninfo:    6: parseTagsProcessor   from  jsdoc\ninfo:    7: tags-parsed (abstract)  from  jsdoc\ninfo:    8: extracting-tags (abstract)  from  jsdoc\ninfo:    9: extractTagsProcessor   from  jsdoc\ninfo:    10: tags-extracted (abstract)  from  jsdoc\ninfo:    11: codeNameProcessor   from  jsdoc\ninfo:    12: processing-docs (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    13: docs-processed (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    14: adding-extra-docs (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    15: extra-docs-added (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    16: computing-ids (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    17: computeIdsProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    18: ids-computed (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    19: computing-paths (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    20: computePathsProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    21: paths-computed (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    22: rendering-docs (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    23: renderDocsProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    24: docs-rendered (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    25: unescapeCommentsProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    26: inlineTagProcessor   from  jsdoc\ninfo:    27: writing-files (abstract)  from  base\ninfo:    28: writeFilesProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    29: checkAnchorLinksProcessor   from  base\ninfo:    30: files-written (abstract)  from  base\n</code></pre>\n<p>In dgeni the input/output of each processor is an array of objects, called <code>docs</code>, and each of those objects contains information about a given jsDoc comment found in the source files.</p>\n<p>Dgeni provides the above default &quot;skeleton&quot; of processors that handle the most common needs.\nFor example there is one processor that extracts the jsDoc comments from the source files and saves them in the <code>docs</code> array and a later one reads that information and build the content to be rendered in each file, which is actually saved to the disk by even another processor... I hope gave you the idea of how dgeni works.</p>\n<p>I do want to reuse most of what <code>dgeni</code> and <code>dgeni-packages</code> already provides, however I find myself in need of cutomizing a few behaviours.\nAs I already told the <code>docs</code> array contains one object for each jsDoc comment and the processor that writes the <code>docs</code> on the hard disk outputs one file for each item in this array. Instead, I need to save just one file for each javascript module in my codebase and each file must contain the information about all functions/classes/constants/etc... belonging to that javascript module (if you are not familiar with js module think of <code>1 module = 1 source code file</code>).</p>\n<p>My question is: which is the best way to interfere/interact with the default implementation of the processors provided by dgeni?\nKeep in mind that later processors may expect to find some properties/data set for each item of the <code>docs</code> array that have been added by previous processors.\nTherefore I must be careful not to break this &quot;contract&quot;.</p>\n<p>Should I override only the <code>writeFilesProcessors()</code> with my custom logic (to obtain the desired output on the hard disk) but nevertheless forward the same <code>docs</code> value that I receive in input (to avoid breaking something in the processors that follows) or is there a better approach?\nShould I instead completely override the <code>computePathsProcessor()</code> (to set the proper output file paths I need) and the <code>renderDocsProcessor()</code> (to aggregate the input array <code>docs</code> according to my custom needs) and forward a new self-made object to the following processors?\nMaybe even something else?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":218,"question_id":65028995,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>The official documentation says this about JIT -</p>\n<p><strong>Just-in-Time (JIT), which compiles your app in the browser at runtime. This was the default until Angular 8.</strong></p>\n<p>I always used to believe that how JIT works is- while running the app on the browser, it sees what all resources are being requested and used to convert those resources in JS files and used to pass it to the browser. Is my understanding correct or is there any flaw in my understanding?</p>\n<p>Can anyone please explain the role of JIT compiler in JS applications and role of JIT compiler in Angular or typescript applications.</p>\n<p>Also, does JIT convert the .ts to .js or does it convert .js to binaries that the browser can understand?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":219,"question_id":65028970,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

'not-allowed' : 'default',\n\n      ':active': {\n        ...styles[':active'],\n        backgroundColor: !isDisabled &amp;&amp; (isSelected ? data.color : color.alpha(0.3).css()),\n      },\n    };\n  },\n  multiValue: (styles, { data }) =&gt; {\n    const color = chroma(data.color);\n    return {\n      ...styles,\n      backgroundColor: color.alpha(0.1).css(),\n    };\n  },\n  multiValueLabel: (styles, { data }) =&gt; ({\n    ...styles,\n    color: data.color,\n  }),\n  multiValueRemove: (styles, { data }) =&gt; ({\n    ...styles,\n    color: data.color,\n    ':hover': {\n      backgroundColor: data.color,\n      color: 'white',\n    },\n  }),\n};\n\nexport default () =&gt; (\n  &lt;Select\n    closeMenuOnSelect={false}\n    defaultValue={[colourOptions[0], colourOptions[1]]}\n    isMulti\n    options={colourOptions}\n    styles={colourStyles}\n  /&gt;\n);\n</code></pre>\n<p>I reduce the width of the select but I noticed the width of the dropdown is not reduced... {"body":"<p>I have build an application for iOS with Swift, where I am using the MapKit Framework from Apple.\nNow I want to build this as a web application with Vue, where I can use this Map as xhr.open(&quot;GET&quot;, &quot;/services/jwt&quot;);\n        xhr.addEventListener(&quot;load&quot;, function() {\n            done(this.responseText);\n        });\n        xhr.send();\n    }\n});\nexport default {\n  name: 'prodmap'\n}\n&lt;/script&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>But I get the error:  <code>TypeError: mapkit.init is not a function</code>.</p>\n<p>How can I initialize the MapKit JS the right way?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":222,"question_id":65028946,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I am trying to integrate workbox with webpack + React project using workbox-webpack-plugin</p>\n<pre><code>npm list workbox-webpack-plugin\n\n+-- react-scripts@3.0.1\n| `-- workbox-webpack-plugin@4.2.0\n</code></pre>\n<p>I want to add some custom code to service worker , hence using WorkboxPlugin.InjectManifest.\nAs per my understanding, since i am using webpack InjectManifest plugin it will take care of bundling  and compiling by itself after workbox 5 .As per google docs :\n<code>The InjectManifest plugin handles both bundling and also injecting the precache manifest for you</code></p>\n<p>My problem is when i am running local dev server, i am getting the below error :</p>\n<p>Scenario 1 : If i am using only <code>workbox.precaching.precacheAndRoute(self.__WB_MANIFEST);</code> inside sw, i am getting below error</p>\n<p>Error : <code>Uncaught ReferenceError: workbox is not defined at Object../src/sw.js (sw.js:1) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:19) at bootstrap:83 at bootstrap:83</code></p>\n<p>Scenario 2 : If i am using</p>\n<pre><code>import {precacheAndRoute} from 'workbox-precaching'\nprecacheAndRoute(self.__WB_MANIFEST);\n</code></pre>\n<p>in sw, i am getting below error:\nError : <code>cacheWrapper.mjs:36 Uncaught ReferenceError: regeneratorRuntime is not defined at cacheWrapper.mjs:36 at Module../node_modules/workbox-core/_private/cacheWrapper.mjs (cacheWrapper.mjs:36) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:19) at Module../node_modules/workbox-precaching/PrecacheController.mjs (pluginUtils.mjs:11) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:19) at Module../node_modules/workbox-precaching/utils/getOrCreatePrecacheController.mjs (getOrCreatePrecacheController.mjs:1) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:19) at Module../node_modules/workbox-precaching/utils/getCacheKeyForURL.mjs (generateURLVariations.mjs:23) at __webpack_require__ (bootstrap:19) at Module../node_modules/workbox-precaching/utils/addFetchListener.mjs (addFetchListener.mjs:1)</code></p>\n<p>I have searched many articles regarding these and but nothing solves my pbm:\nSearched article : <a href=\"https://github.com/GoogleChrome/workbox/issues/2493\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://github.com/GoogleChrome/workbox/issues/2493</a></p>\n<p>webpack.config.dev.js</p>\n<pre><code>const WorkboxPlugin = require('workbox-webpack-plugin');\nnew
