{"body":"<p>I'm trying to install Editor.js using node.js package in my hello-express <a href=\"https://glitch.com\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Glitch</a> project. This is the package via NPM:</p>\n<pre><code>npm i @editorjs/editorjs --save\n</code></pre>\n<p>I included the module in my javascript file as mentioned in the editor.js <a href=\"https://editorjs.io/getting-started\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">documentation</a>:</p>\n<pre><code>import EditorJS from '@editorjs/editorjs';\nconst editor = new EditorJS();\n</code></pre>\n<p>But the following error appears in the browser console:</p>\n<p><strong>Uncaught SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module</strong></p>\n<p>I'm sure it's a bad installation in my Glitch project but I don't know how to fix it. {"body":"<p>I'm trying to make some code to resize an element to the mouse cursor, with the element &quot;anchored&quot; to a certain starting position. However, it quickly falls apart when the element is rotated. Here's my code right now:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>var block = document.getElementById(\"block\");\nvar desiredX = block.offsetLeft;\nvar desiredY = block.offsetTop;\nfunction resize(event) {\n    block.style.left = Math.min(event.pageX, desiredX) + \"px\";\n    block.style.top = Math.min(event.pageY, desiredY) + \"px\";\n    block.style.width = Math.abs(event.pageX - desiredX) + \"px\";\n    block.style.height = Math.abs(event.pageY - desiredY) + \"px\";\n}\ndocument.addEventListener(\"mousemove\", resize);</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>#block {\n    height: 10em;\n    width: 2em;\n    background-color: gray;\n    border: 1px solid black;\n    position: absolute;\n  zIndex: 1;\n    cursor: pointer;\n}\n#inputs {\n  zIndex: 2;\n  position: absolute;\n  right: 10px;\n  bottom: 10px;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div id=\"block\" style=\"left: 50px; top: 50px;\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"inputs\"&gt;&lt;label for=\"rotation\"&gt;Rotate block:&lt;/label&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;input type=\"range\" min=\"0\" max=\"360\" value=\"0\" id=\"rotation\" style=\"width: 250px\" oninput=\"block.style.transform = 'rotate(' + this.value + 'deg)'\"&gt;&lt;/input&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>How can I make it so that the corner of the block will always reach the cursor, regardless of rotation?</p>\n<p>I did find a similar question/answer (<a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20366892/resizing-handles-on-a-rotated-element\">Resizing Handles on a Rotated Element</a>), but I couldn't figure out how to properly adapt the answer for this situation. Here was my failed attempt at doing so:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>var block = document.getElementById(\"block\");\nvar desiredX = block.offsetLeft;\nvar desiredY = block.offsetTop;\nfunction resize(event) {\n  var angle = +block.style.transform.replace(/[^0-9]/gi, '')*(Math.PI/180);\n  var len = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(event.pageX - block.offsetLeft, 2)+Math.pow(event.pageY - block.offsetTop, 2));\n    block.style.left = Math.min(event.pageX, desiredX) + \"px\";\n    block.style.top = Math.min(event.pageY, desiredY) + \"px\";\n    block.style.width = Math.abs(Math.sin(angle)*len) + \"px\";\n    block.style.height = Math.abs(Math.cos(angle)*len) + \"px\";\n}\ndocument.addEventListener(\"mousemove\", resize);</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>#block {\n        height: 10em;\n        width: 2em;\n        background-color: gray;\n        border: 1px solid black;\n        position: absolute;\n      zIndex: 1;\n        cursor: pointer;\n    }\n    #inputs {\n      zIndex: 2;\n      position: absolute;\n      right: 10px;\n      bottom: 10px;\n    }</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div id=\"block\" style=\"left: 50px; top: 50px;\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"inputs\"&gt;&lt;label for=\"rotation\"&gt;Rotate block:&lt;/label&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&lt;input type=\"range\" min=\"0\" max=\"360\" value=\"0\" id=\"rotation\" style=\"width: 250px\" oninput=\"block.style.transform = 'rotate(' + this.value + 'deg)'\"&gt;&lt;/input&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":225,"question_id":65028852,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have a React app using NodeJS and Express hosted on Heroku. We use use-sound.js, which is a 3rd party hook built on howler.js to play ambient sound as well as sound effects. On all 4 of our local machines, the sound will work fine.</p>\n<p>Intended behaviour: When the site is loaded, an icon on the top left allows the user to unmute the ambient sound which will also enable SFX when the game is started.</p>\n<p>Current behaviour: When the site is loaded, the icon indicates the sound is unmuted. When the button is clicked, the icon toggles and the audio menu button appears. However, no sound is played and nothing is displayed in the console logs which would indicate any problems at all.</p>\n<p><strong>Code</strong><br />\nGitHub: <a href=\"https://github.com/AlecWGreene/MSU-Project3-Four-Horsemen\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://github.com/AlecWGreene/MSU-Project3-Four-Horsemen</a><br />\nDeployed Site: <a href=\"https://ashen-void.herokuapp.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://ashen-void.herokuapp.com/</a><br />\nBuild Packs:\n<a href=\"https://github.com/timanovsky/subdir-heroku-buildpack.git\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://github.com/timanovsky/subdir-heroku-buildpack.git</a>\nNodeJS</p>\n<p><strong>Relevant Code Snippets</strong><br />\nSoundSuite Component</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useState, useContext, createContext } from 'react';\nimport useSound from 'use-sound';\nimport soundEnums from '../../../game/SpriteEnums.js';\nimport SfxOptions from '../SfxOptions/index';\nimport ButtonGroup from 'react-bootstrap/ButtonGroup';\n\nimport './style.css'\nimport SfxButton from '../SfxButton/index.js';\n\nfunction SoundSuite({ children }) {\n  const sfx = useProvideSfx();\n    \n  return (\n    &lt;&gt;\n      &lt;sfxContext.Provider value={sfx}&gt;\n        \n        &lt;SfxButton /&gt;\n\n        {children}\n\n      &lt;/sfxContext.Provider&gt;\n    &lt;/&gt;\n  )\n};\n\n// access context provider state and methods\nexport function useSfx() {\n  return useContext(sfxContext);\n}\n\nexport default SoundSuite;\n\n// create new context instance of sfxContext to keep track of sound effect states accross the site\nconst sfxContext = createContext();\n\n// context provider state and methods\nfunction useProvideSfx() {\n\n  const [soundEnabled, setSoundEnabled] = useState(false);\n  const [playbackRate, setPlaybackRate] = useState(1);\n  const [masterVol, setMasterVol] = useState(1.0);\n  const [nextFile, setNextFile] = useState('');\n  const [ambientFile, setAmbientFile] = useState('Sound_background_0');\n  const [sfxFile, setSfxFile] = useState('Sound_pop_0');\n  const [ambientVol, setAmbientVol] = useState(0.5);\n  const [sfxVol, setSfxVol] = useState(0.5);\n  const [auto, setAuto] = useState(false);\n  const [sfxAuto, setSFXAuto] = useState(false);\n\n  const [play, { pause, stop, isPlaying } ] = useSound(\n    soundEnums[ambientFile].src,\n    { \n      autoplay: auto,\n      preload: true,\n      volume: masterVol*ambientVol,\n      loop: true,\n      playbackRate,\n      id: ambientFile\n    }, \n  );\n\n  const [playSfx, { sound }] = useSound(\n    soundEnums[sfxFile].src,\n    { \n      autoplay: sfxAuto,\n      preload: true,\n      loop: false,\n      volume: masterVol*sfxVol,\n      id: sfxFile,\n      soundEnabled\n    }, \n  );\n\n  const mute = (enable) =&gt; {\n    if(enable) {\n      setSFXAuto(false);\n      setAuto(true);\n      setSoundEnabled(true);\n      play(ambientFile);\n    }else{\n      setAuto(false);\n      setSFXAuto(false);\n      setSoundEnabled(false);\n      pause();\n    };\n  };\n\n  // rate may be adjusted from 0.5x -&gt; 4x the original speed\n  const playbackSpeed = (rate) =&gt; {\n    setPlaybackRate(rate);\n  };\n\n  // ambient sound volume may be adjusted from 0 (muted) -&gt; 1 (max)\n  const masterVolume = (vol) =&gt; {\n    setMasterVol(vol);\n  };\n\n  // play next after song ends - requires a void/while loop or event listener to execute the if statement logic with isPlaying. \n  // could also attempt to set up an event listenr with ambient sound and playNext values to begin testing for isPlaying in order to render next mp3 file.\n  const playNext = (file) =&gt; {\n    if(isPlaying) {\n      setNextFile(file);\n    }\n  };\n\n  // force ambient sound to play new file\n  const ambientSound = (file) =&gt; {\n    \n    if(ambientFile!==file) {\n      setAmbientFile(file);\n      if(!soundEnabled){\n        return;\n      }\n      setAuto(true);\n      pause();\n    }else{\n      if(!soundEnabled){\n        return;\n      }\n      setAuto(true);\n      setAmbientFile(file);\n      stop();\n      play();\n    }\n  };\n\n  // force sfx to paly new sound\n  const sfxSound = (file) =&gt; {\n    if(!soundEnabled){\n      return;\n    }\n\n    setSFXAuto(true); // keeps buttons from triggering upon first click while muted when set to false\n    setAuto(true);\n    \n    // if file is different than current sfxfile, unmount current sound\n    if(sfxFile!==file) {\n      sound.unload(sfxFile)\n    }\n    // play next sound\n    setSfxFile(file, nextOne(file));\n  };\n\n  // ambient sound volume may be adjusted from 0 (muted) -&gt; 1 (max)\n  const ambientVolume = (vol) =&gt; {\n    setAmbientVol(vol);\n  };\n\n  // volume of sound effects may be adjusted from 0 (muted) -&gt; 1 (max)\n  const sfxVolume = (vol) =&gt; {\n    setSfxVol(vol);\n  };\n\n  const nextOne = (file) =&gt; {\n    playSfx(file);\n  };\n\n  return { mute, playbackSpeed, masterVolume, playNext, ambientSound, sfxSound, ambientVolume, sfxVolume, soundEnabled, playbackRate, masterVol, nextFile, ambientFile, sfxFile, ambientVol, sfxVol };\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p>SFX Button component</p>\n<pre><code>import React from 'react';\nimport SfxOptions from '../SfxOptions/index';\nimport ButtonGroup from 'react-bootstrap/ButtonGroup';\nimport { useSfx } from &quot;../../components/SoundSuite/index&quot;;\n\nimport &quot;./style.css&quot;\n\nexport default function SfxButton() {\n\n  const sfx = useSfx();\n  \n  const toggle = (event) =&gt; {\n    event.preventDefault();\n    event.stopPropagation();\n    if(event.target.id==='play'){\n      sfx.mute(true);\n    }else if(event.target.id==='mute'){\n      sfx.mute(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n    return (\n        &lt;div className=&quot;sound-bar&quot; value={sfx}&gt;\n          {\n            !sfx.soundEnabled \n          ?\n            (\n              &lt;div className=&quot;row align-items-center phone-row&quot;&gt;\n                &lt;div className=&quot;col-sm-2 soundwave&quot;&gt;\n                   &lt;button id='play' onClick={toggle}&gt;\n                    &lt;svg width=&quot;1.5em&quot; height=&quot;1.5em&quot; viewBox=&quot;0 0 16 16&quot; class=&quot;bi bi-soundwave sound-icon&quot; fill=&quot;white&quot; xmlns=&quot;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&quot;&gt;\n                      &lt;path fill-rule=&quot;evenodd&quot; d=&quot;M8.5 2a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v11a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-11a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-2 2a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v7a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm4 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v7a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-6 1.5A.5.5 0 0 1 5 6v4a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V6a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm8 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v4a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V6a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-10 1A.5.5 0 0 1 3 7v2a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm12 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v2a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5z&quot;/&gt;\n                    &lt;/svg&gt;\n                  &lt;/button&gt;\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div className=&quot;col-sm-10 game-title-phone&quot;&gt;\n                    AsheN Void\n                &lt;/div&gt;\n              &lt;/div&gt;\n             \n            )\n          : \n            (\n              &lt;ButtonGroup className=&quot;mr-2&quot; aria-label=&quot;First group&quot;&gt;  \n                &lt;button id='mute' onClick={toggle}&gt; \n                  &lt;svg width=&quot;1.5em&quot; height=&quot;1.5em&quot; viewBox=&quot;0 0 16 16&quot; class=&quot;bi bi-soundwave sound-icon&quot; fill=&quot;white&quot; xmlns=&quot;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&quot;&gt;\n                    &lt;path fill-rule=&quot;evenodd&quot; d=&quot;M8.5 2a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v11a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-11a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-2 2a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v7a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm4 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v7a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0v-7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-6 1.5A.5.5 0 0 1 5 6v4a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V6a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm8 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v4a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V6a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm-10 1A.5.5 0 0 1 3 7v2a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5zm12 0a.5.5 0 0 1 .5.5v2a.5.5 0 0 1-1 0V7a.5.5 0 0 1 .5-.5z&quot;/&gt;\n                  &lt;/svg&gt;\n                &lt;/button&gt;\n                \n                &lt;SfxOptions /&gt;\n              \n              &lt;/ButtonGroup&gt;\n            )\n          }\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    )\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>App component</p>\n<pre><code>import React from &quot;react&quot;;\nimport { Router, Route, Switch} from &quot;react-router-dom&quot;;\nimport UserAuth from &quot;./userInterface/components/UserAuth/index&quot;\nimport PrivateRoute from &quot;./userInterface/components/PrivateRoute/index&quot;\nimport PreventReverse from &quot;./userInterface/components/PreventReverse/index&quot;;\nimport history from &quot;./utils/history&quot;;\nimport Nav from &quot;./userInterface/components/Nav&quot;;\nimport Wrapper from &quot;./userInterface/components/Wrapper&quot;;\nimport Rules from &quot;./userInterface/pages/Rules&quot;;\nimport SignUp from &quot;./userInterface/pages/SignUp&quot;;\nimport LogIn from &quot;./userInterface/pages/LogIn&quot;;\nimport GamePage from &quot;./userInterface/pages/GamePage&quot;;\n// import NoMatch from &quot;./userInterface/pages/NoMatch&quot;;\nimport ContentWrapper from &quot;./userInterface/components/Wrapper/ContentWrapper&quot;;\nimport GameContainer from &quot;./userInterface/components/GameContainer/index&quot;\nimport HomePage from &quot;./userInterface/pages/HomePage&quot;;\nimport LoadingPage from &quot;./userInterface/pages/LoadingPage&quot;\nimport SoundSuite from &quot;./userInterface/components/SoundSuite/index&quot;\n\n\nfunction App() {\n\n  return (\n    &lt;UserAuth&gt;\n      &lt;SoundSuite&gt;\n\n        &lt;Router history={history}&gt;\n\n          &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;Wrapper&gt;\n\n              &lt;Switch&gt;\n\n              &lt;PreventReverse path=&quot;/&quot; exact&gt;\n                  &lt;ContentWrapper&gt;\n                    &lt;HomePage /&gt;\n                  &lt;/ContentWrapper&gt;\n                &lt;/PreventReverse&gt;\n\n                &lt;PreventReverse path=&quot;/rules&quot;&gt;\n path=&quot;/login&quot;&gt;\n                  &lt;ContentWrapper&gt;\n                    &lt;LogIn /&gt; \n                  &lt;/ContentWrapper&gt;\n                &lt;/PreventReverse&gt;\n\n                &lt;PreventReverse path=&quot;/signup&quot;&gt;\n                  &lt;ContentWrapper&gt;\n                    &lt;SignUp /&gt;\n                  &lt;/ContentWrapper&gt;\n {"body":"<p>I am making a simple top down car game in Phaser3. At the moment, my car moves at a constant speed. However, I would like it to behave more realistically, with elements such as drag/friction/acceleration applied to it, a bit like the example at <a href=\"http://domasx2.github.io/gamejs-box2d-car-example/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">http://domasx2.github.io/gamejs-box2d-car-example/</a>. How do I get it to behave this way using the Phaser Physics arcade engine (which the rest of my game currently uses).</p>\n<p>My code is as follows:</p>\n<pre><code>import Phaser from &quot;phaser&quot;;\n\nconst config = {\n  type: Phaser.AUTO,\n  parent: &quot;phaser-example&quot;,\n  width: 800,\n  height: 600,\n  physics: {\n    default: &quot;arcade&quot;,\n    arcade: {\n      debug: true\n    }\n  },\n  scene: {\n    preload: preload,\n    create: create,\n    update: update,\n    render: render\n  }\n};\n\nconst game = new Phaser.Game(config);\nlet platform;\nlet player;\nlet cursors;\n\nfunction preload() {\n  this.load.image(&quot;car&quot;, &quot;https://labs.phaser.io/assets/sprites/car90.png&quot;);\n  this.load.image(&quot;sky&quot;, &quot;https://labs.phaser.io/assets/skies/gradient11.png&quot;);\n}\n\nfunction create() {\n  this.add.image(400, 300, &quot;sky&quot;);\n\n  player = this.physics.add.sprite(400, 300, &quot;car&quot;, 1);\n  player.body.setBounce(20, 20);\n  player.setCollideWorldBounds(true);\n\n  cursors = this.input.keyboard.createCursorKeys();\n\n  this.physics.add.collider(player, platform);\n}\n\nfunction update() {\n  player.body.velocity.x = 0;\n  player.body.velocity.y = 0;\n  player.body.angularVelocity = 0;\n\n  if (cursors.left.isDown) {\n    player.body.angularVelocity = -150;\n  }\n  if (cursors.right.isDown) {\n    player.body.angularVelocity = 150;\n  }\n\n  if (cursors.up.isDown) {\n    this.physics.velocityFromRotation(\n      player.rotation,\n      150,\n      player.body.velocity\n    );\n  }\n  if (cursors.down.isDown) {\n    this.physics.velocityFromRotation(\n      player.rotation,\n      -150,\n      player.body.velocity\n    );\n  }\n}\n\nfunction render() {}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Stackblitz demo here: <a href=\"https://stackblitz.com/edit/phaser3-typescript-d6zbzf\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://stackblitz.com/edit/phaser3-typescript-d6zbzf</a>.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":228,"question_id":65028800,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>i have pretty basic question. sorry for that.\nI'm trying to build result point system for test. but there is that problem everything is printing together. there is a code:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>    var g_Point = [8,9,10];\n    var n_Point = [5,6,7];\n    var b_Point = [1,2,3,4];\n\n    var my_Points = 10;\n    if(my_Points === g_Point){\n        document.write('You Got Really Good Point');\n    }else if(my_Points === n_Point){\n        document.write('You Got Normal Points');\n    }else if(my_Points === b_Point){\n        document.write('You Got Really Bad Points');\n    }</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":229,"question_id":65028778,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have a code that is copying from sheet &quot;A&quot; to sheet &quot;B&quot; in the same spreadsheet However when I click the button to copy and paste, it changes the screen and you can see how it pastes the values in sheet &quot;B&quot; once is done it returns to sheet &quot;A&quot;. I want to be able to copy and paste but similar to excel where you can hide the actions of the script and just wait until is done, is it possible?</p>\n<p>I'm starting to code with gscript here is a piece of the code:</p>\n<pre><code>var A_Sheet='A'\nvar B_Sheet= 'B'\nvar ss = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet ();\nvar spreadsheet = ss.getSheetByName(A_Sheet);\nspreadsheet.activate()\n\nif (Browser.msgBox('TEXT', 'Do you want to save changes?', Browser.Buttons.YES_NO) == 'yes') {\n        if(spreadsheet.getRange('C4').isBlank()  || spreadsheet.getRange('C5').isBlank() || spreadsheet.getRange('C6').isBlank()|| spreadsheet.getRange('C7').isBlank())\n{\n  Browser.msgBox(&quot;You have missing Data on TEXT!&quot;)\n  }\n      else{\n        \nvar spreadsheet2 = ss.getSheetByName(B_Sheet);\nvar Avals = spreadsheet2.getRange(&quot;A1:A&quot;).getValues();\nvar Alast = Avals.filter(String).length + 1;\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('C3').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('A'+ Alast).setValue(a);\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('C4').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('B'+ Alast).setValue(a);\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('C5').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('C'+ Alast).setValue(a);\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('C6').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('D'+ Alast).setValue(a);\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('C7').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('E'+ Alast).setValue(a);\nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('F3').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('F'+ Alast).setValue(a);            \nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('G4').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('I'+ Alast).setValue(a); \nvar a =     spreadsheet.getRange('F7').getValue(); \nspreadsheet2.getRange('J'+ Alast).setValue(a); \n\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":230,"question_id":65028759,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I am a student and my assignment is to develop a tic tac toe game using JavaScript. The part I am stuck on is reading the html value of the squares. X and O is passed as the parameter elem to the function determineWinner(elem). How can I check if all 3 squares match the content of the parameter &quot;elem&quot;?\nIn my if statement, I've tried using winningPos[i][0].innerHTML etc. But it only reads the index and not the html value. Any help with this would be appreciated.</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function determineWinner(elem) {\n\n  var winningPos = [\n    [0, 1, 2],\n    [3, 4, 5],\n    [6, 7, 8],\n    [0, 3, 6],\n    [1, 4, 7],\n    [2, 5, 8],\n    [0, 4, 8],\n    [2, 4, 6]\n  ];\n\n  var i, j;\n\n  for (var i = 0; i &lt; winningPos.length; i++) {\n    for (var j = 0; j &lt; winningPos[i].length; j++) {\n      if (winningPos[i][0] == elem &amp;&amp; winningPos[i][1] == elem &amp;&amp; winningPos[i][2] == elem) {\n        document.getElementById(\"status\").innerHTML = \"Game Over!\";\n        if (elem == \"X\") {\n          document.getElementById(\"message\").innerHTML = \"User is the winner!!!\";\n        } else if (elem == \"O\") {\n          document.getElementById(\"message\").innerHTML = \"Computer is the winner!!!\";\n        } else\n          break;\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div class=\"main\"&gt;\n  &lt;div id=\"message\"&gt;Welcome to the game of tic tac toe. {"body":"<p>I am trying to use CloudKit JS for a web app and I have tried to use the CloudKit JS Apple-hosted script using the following as suggested by Apple:</p>\n<p><code>&lt;script src=&quot;https://cdn.apple-cloudkit.com/ck/2/cloudkit.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</code></p>\n<p>I am getting the following error:</p>\n<p><code>DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not parse content for https://cdn.apple-cloudkit.com/ck/2/resources/cloudkit.js.map: Unexpected token &lt; in JSON at position 0</code></p>\n<p>I took a look at <a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/61339968/devtools-failed-to-load-sourcemap-could-not-load-content-for-chrome-extension\">this question</a>, and one of the answers said that the error is caused by a line similar to <code>//# sourceMappingURL=include.prepload.js.map</code>. I see a line at the end of the CloudKit script similar to this which is <code>//# sourceMappingURL=resources/cloudkit.js.map</code>. {"body":"<p>I have the code below. The EXPECTED behavior is as follows:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>When the page loads the form field should be in focus.</li>\n<li>When the user clicks the up/down arrows the items in the list should be selected via a CSS background color change.</li>\n<li>When the user types into the form field, an &quot;instant search&quot; is applied to the list and only items that match the search appear.</li>\n<li>If the user types an item that is not in the list and they submit it, the page should automatically update with the list appearing and the new item in the list.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Everything seems to work until step 4. If you try to submit an item to the list the page does not update with the new items and the form loses focus.</p>\n<p>I've created this script before with React using ref and useEffect. I am exploring SVELTE to see what a similar script looks like.</p>\n<p>Thank you!</p>\n<p><strong>Interactive example:</strong></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://svelte.dev/repl/a544e3d48d3f46c89249d16c10270f0f?version=3.30.0\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://svelte.dev/repl/a544e3d48d3f46c89249d16c10270f0f?version=3.30.0</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\n    import { onMount } from 'svelte';\n    let clients = [&quot;a Little piggy&quot;,&quot;b little piggy&quot;,&quot;c little piggy&quot;]; //hard coded api data\n    let clientsClone = [...clients];\n    let indexVal = -1;\n    let downArrowPress = 40;\n    let upArrowPress = 38;\n    let clientInputTextField = &quot;&quot;;\n    let selectedClient = &quot;&quot;;\n\n     //______________________BEGIN focus input field on page load\n\n     onMount(function() {\n        clientInputTextField.focus();\n     });\n\n     //_______________________END focus input field on page load.\n\n\n     // ______________________BEGIN instant search algorithm \n    function instantSearch(query,listArr) {\n        let arr = [...listArr]\n        let newList = []\n\n       arr.map(val =&gt;{\n            query.split(&quot; &quot;).map(word =&gt;{\n                if(val.toLowerCase().indexOf(word.toLowerCase()) != -1){\n                    newList.push(val)\n                }\n            })\n       })\n       \n       console.log(newList)\n       return newList\n    }\n    //_________________________END instant search algorithm\n\n\n    function handleKeydown(event){\n        \n    \n        if(event.keyCode === upArrowPress){\n           indexVal-=1;    \n           indexVal = indexVal &lt; 0 ?  clients.length : indexVal\n           console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(event.keyCode === downArrowPress){\n           indexVal+=1;\n           indexVal = indexVal &gt; clients.length ?  0 : indexVal\n           console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(indexVal &gt; clients.length -1 || indexVal &lt; 0){\n           clientInputTextField.focus(); \n        }else{\n            clientInputTextField.blur()\n        }\n    \n     }\n\n     \n     function searchItems(event){\n        console.log(event.target.value)\n        let result = instantSearch(event.target.value, clients);\n        clientsClone = [...result]\n        console.log(result)\n        \n     }\n\n\n     function handleSubmit(){\n  \n        console.log(selectedClient)\n        clients.push(selectedClient)\n        selectedClient = &quot;&quot;;\n\n\n     }\n\n\n\n\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n\n&lt;svelte:window on:keydown={handleKeydown}/&gt;\n\n&lt;form on:submit|preventDefault={handleSubmit}&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;&quot;  on:input={searchItems} bind:this={clientInputTextField} bind:value={selectedClient}&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;submit&quot; name=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n\n\n&lt;ul&gt;\n    {#each clientsClone as client, i}\n        {#if i === indexVal}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;background-color:orange&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n            {:else}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n        {/if}\n    {/each}\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>EDIT</strong></p>\n<p>The &quot;instant search&quot; is such a mess that I really only have the following code working:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://svelte.dev/repl/a52d1935209f4cbbb8289b0096374288?version=3.30.0\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://svelte.dev/repl/a52d1935209f4cbbb8289b0096374288?version=3.30.0</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;script&gt;\n    import { onMount } from 'svelte';\n    let clients = [&quot;a Little piggy&quot;,&quot;b little piggy&quot;,&quot;c little piggy&quot;]; \n    let indexVal = -1;\n    let downArrowPress = 40;\n    let upArrowPress = 38;\n    let clientInputTextField = &quot;&quot;;\n\n\n\n     onMount(function() {\n        clientInputTextField.focus();\n     });\n\n\n\n    function handleKeydown(event){\n        \n    \n        if(event.keyCode === upArrowPress){\n           indexVal-=1;    \n           indexVal = indexVal &lt; 0 ?  clients.length : indexVal\n           console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(event.keyCode === downArrowPress){\n           indexVal+=1;\n           indexVal = indexVal &gt; clients.length ?  0 : indexVal\n           console.log(indexVal);\n        }\n\n        if(indexVal &gt; clients.length -1 || indexVal &lt; 0){\n           clientInputTextField.focus(); \n        }else{\n            clientInputTextField.blur()\n        }\n    \n     }\n\n\n\n\n\n\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n\n&lt;svelte:window on:keydown={handleKeydown}/&gt;\n\n&lt;form&gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;&quot; bind:this={clientInputTextField} &gt;\n    &lt;input type=&quot;submit&quot; name=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;\n\n\n\n&lt;ul&gt;\n    {#each clients as client, i}\n        {#if i === indexVal}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;background-color:orange&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n            {:else}\n            &lt;li style=&quot;&quot;&gt;{client}&lt;/li&gt;\n        {/if}\n    {/each}\n&lt;/ul&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":236,"question_id":65028562,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Is it possible to save this event in local storage without using libraries?</p>\n<p>I saw some solutions here on stackoverflow and on the internet with jQuery but it’s not exactly what I need and I was not able to convert...</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const click = document.querySelector(\".click\")\nconst content = document.querySelector(\".content\")\n\nclick.addEventListener(\"click\", function(){\n    if(content.classList.contains(\"active\")){\n    content.classList.remove(\"active\")\n  }\n  else{\n    content.classList.add(\"active\")\n  }\n})</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.content{\n  display:none;\n}\n\n.active{\n  display: block;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div class=\"click\"&gt;\n  Click me\n&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;div class=\"content\"&gt;\n  Hey!\n&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":237,"question_id":65028542,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I want to create a widget for iOS that shows my mobile traffic usage.\nTo create this widget I want to use <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/de/app/scriptable/id1405459188\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Scriptable</a></p>\n<p>I tried to create the needed Http GET and POST requests to login into my account and than to read the needed values, but I failed already with the login.</p>\n<p>Here is my code:</p>\n<pre><code>// Variables used by Scriptable.\n// These must be at the very top of the file. Do not edit.\n// icon-color: red; icon-glyph: magic;\n\nconst loginPageUrl = &quot;https://service.premiumsim.de&quot;;\nconst loginUrl = &quot;https://service.premiumsim.de/public/login_check&quot;;\n\nlet cookies = null;\nlet sid = null;\nlet csrf_token = null;\n\n//TODO: Use scriptable parameter\nconst username = &quot;USERNAME&quot;;\nconst password = &quot;PASSWORD&quot;;\n\nawait prepareLoginData();\nawait doLogin();\n\nasync function doLogin()\n{\n    try\n    {\n        // Post login data\n        let req = new Request(loginUrl);\n        req.method = 'POST';\n\n        req.headers = {\n            'Cookie': cookies,\n            'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:72.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/72.0',\n            'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8',\n            'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',\n            'Origin': loginPageUrl,\n            'Connection': 'keep-alive',\n            'Referer': loginPageUrl,\n            'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1',\n            'TE': 'Trailers'\n        };\n\n        // This looks the same as in firefox\n        req.body = &quot;_SID=&quot; + sid + &quot;&amp;UserLoginType%5Balias%5D=&quot; + username + &quot;&amp;UserLoginType%5Bpassword%5D=&quot; + password + &quot;&amp;UserLoginType%5Blogindata%5D=&amp;UserLoginType%5Bcsrf_token%5D=&quot; + csrf_token;\n\n        var resp = await req.loadString();\n        await QuickLook.present(req.response);\n        console.log(req.response.statusCode); // This should be 302 but is 200\n\n        let view = new WebView();\n        view.loadHTML(resp);\n        await view.present();\n    }\n    catch (e)\n    {\n        console.error(e);\n    }\n}\n\nasync function prepareLoginData()\n{\n    try\n    {\n        // Get login page\n        let req;\n        req = new Request(loginPageUrl);\n        req.method = 'GET';\n        req.headers = {\n            'Cookie': '',\n            'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:72.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/72.0',\n            'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8',\n            'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',\n            'Connection': 'keep-alive',\n            'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1',\n            'TE': 'Trailers'\n        };\n\n        var resp = await req.loadString();\n\n        // Get setted cookies\n        let CookieValues = req.response.cookies.map(function (v)\n        {\n            return v.name + &quot;=&quot; + v.value\n        });\n\n        // Parse csrf token\n        resp = resp.substr(resp.indexOf('UserLoginType_csrf_token'), 500);\n        resp = resp.substr(resp.indexOf('value=&quot;') + 7);\n        csrf_token = resp.substr(0, resp.indexOf('&quot;'));\n\n        console.log(&quot;Found csrf_token: &quot; + csrf_token);\n\n        cookies = CookieValues.join('; ') + '; isCookieAllowed=true';\n        console.log(&quot;Found cookies: &quot; + cookies);\n\n        // Get sid\n        sid = cookies.substring(5, cookies.indexOf(';'));\n        console.log(&quot;Got _SID: &quot; + sid);\n    }\n    catch (e)\n    {\n        console.error(e);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Loading the login page works as expected. Parsing out csrf token works also.\nWhen posting these values to the login url, I expect to get the status code 302 with an redirect to <a href=\"https://service.premiumsim.de/start\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://service.premiumsim.de/start</a>\nThis is, what I've seen using firefox.</p>\n<p>I already copied all headers that firefox also send and I did POST and GET requests to my local webserver, to see if the passed form values comes correct to the webserver. I don't know what's going wrong.</p>\n<p>See also: <a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47103183/how-to-generate-userlogintype-token-for-login-request\">How to generate UserLoginType[_token] for login request</a>\nIt's done here with another technique but it's the same content that is send.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":238,"question_id":65028506,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
